Reviews.Title: love it,  well sort of
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: i bought it as a gift, specifically for the screen size to be easy on aging eyes, and the user hasn't been on a computer in many years, maybe 15, so it's like starting over.  the one dislike is the screen does not seem to have a good resolution.  no matter what adjustments are made, it's dim, and tiring to use for a long period of time.  it does brighten up when it's plugged in, but that defeats the purpose of a lap top, she also feels the mouse/cursor tracking is awkward, so she uses a wired mouse for better control.  so i (we) say, nice machine for short term use.

Reviews.Title: Love it!!
Reviews.Author: kimerrie
Reviews.Content: I truly love my new Lenovo laptop.  I had never used (or even heard of) the Lenovo brand.  My daughter asked the I.T. folks where she worked if they would recommend a computer brand for me and they named the Lenovo.  I am so glad they did.

Reviews.Title: Good "mobile desktop" system
Reviews.Author: Brian
Reviews.Content: I chose this laptop because:1. It was the cheapest system with a screen resolution better than 1366x7682. I did not plan on lugging it around in a backpack on a regular basisThus far it has performed well at all intended tasks:1. Interface computer for finish-line camera and timing at track meets (high resolution screen really helps)2. CPU-driven media player that interfaces with a bio-feedback USB system (movies fade out when bio-feedback is negative, movies play normally when bio-feedback is positive)3. Output media via HDMI to my media center for websites that do not have an app on my WDTV LiveThe Pentium 3550M has handled everything we've thrown at it so far with ease (after implementing the software recommendations below). It is an excellent general-use system.Software recommendations:1. Disable the Lenovo system monitoring features. This thing sucks up resources attempting to track and report how the system is being used. Win 8 has excellent system monitoring tools that don't kill performance.2. Remove McAfee and use a different security suite. McAfee brought the whole system to a crawl and will not yield resources to basic, non-dangerous OS usage. Norton Internet Security works fine without making the system unusable.Other notes:1. I added a 4-GB memory stick to bring the total memory to 8-GB2. Even with the mechanical HDD I am happy with the boot up and program load times. However, I do not turn this computer on/off many times a day.3. Windows 8 - if you haven't used it yet expect to waste a few hours figuring out how to do tasks you have taken for granted since 2001 (WinXP)4. Good bags for 17,3" laptops tend to cost more than 16" and smaller laptops. I got lucky and found a rolling bag on sale at a local store for half a Franklin, but many of them available locally and online cost a whole Franklin or more.5. It takes some time to get used to the numpad on a laptop. My right hand automatically moves to the right edge of the keyboard. I wish there was a visual separator between the main keyboard and the numpad such as a gray or silver line.6. Intel HDMI drivers, including the ones included with this system, are a bit flaky when sync'ing to a home receiver. They do not properly detect the display settings for my TV through the receiver. To get around this:  (1) attach computer to receiver, if not displaying properly on TV,  (2) attach computer directly to TV, make sure display settings are correct,  (3) attach computer to receiver, and voila!  These steps have worked for me on many systems with Intel CPU

Reviews.Title: I love this! !

Reviews.Content: This is my dream computer!! It is large, fast, and does everything I need it to do!  I would buy this 10x

Reviews.Title: Nice computer
Reviews.Author: James Neumerski
Reviews.Content: But I dislike Windows 8.1 because I find it to be intrusive and a front end for all things Microsoft.  McAfee is built in with a 30 day trial and what happens at the end of that trial?

Reviews.Title: touching screen is useless!
Reviews.Author: Fabio
Reviews.Content: I'm really disappointed cause basically I can't use the touching screen. it's just so insensitive and maybe only works once every 5 or more moves, let alone locating to where u want it to be. There's one time I literally tried 10min to shut down the PC but failed. common, my 4 years old PC works a million times better than it does!  I didn't expect too much on this PC at first considering its price and it's just used to read PDF anyway, but still...... I didn't know it would drive me crazy even what i want is just turning the pages. About the appearance and display screen, it's just OK. so if u're OK with carrying a mouse wherever u go, and 10 min for shutting it down, congrats, it's OK for u.
